text: Claude still hedges on positioning — wants to sell both language and benchmark. Should fully commit to Paper A framing.
Novelty claims about tiered compliance are unstable while validation remains asymmetric. Novelty should be defined as falsifiable empirical deltas.
Exp 0 secondary token-efficiency claims are directly contaminated by validator asymmetry — cross-condition comparisons need qualification.
Canonical semantic scoring is more fundamental than validator symmetry — primary endpoint denominator validity is at stake. Claude's #1 priority was wrong.
Shannon framing urgency should be higher — risk exists now during any outward communication, not only at paper-writing time.
Paper A framing decision should constrain scope decisions NOW, not after Exp 1.
Formal semantics overclaim should be fixed immediately, not deferred.
LLM judge presence criteria are permissive and subjective. Need to predefine machine-scored vs judge-scored by condition.
Minimal AXON-JSON canonical mapping should move earlier — strengthens evaluation, not just adoption.
Strict English validators can become prompt-conformance policing rather than meaningful semantic comparability.
Prereg governance risk: protocol freeze/amendment discipline not discussed despite frozen DEVIATION.md status.
30-item human subset may be too small to certify condition-level bias across 6 formats and 9 tasks.
Fairness protocol and deviation protocol are not fully aligned on judge framing/details.
Reliability (agreement) is being used as substitute for construct validity — agreement doesn't prove condition-invariant semantic validity of denominator.
English validator logic in D2 moves into semantic territory, risking circularity between compliance and semantic scoring.
Selective human subset expansion can introduce bias without pre-locked trigger rule.
English scoring contract must be frozen at Tier 1 alongside canonical representations, not deferred to Tier 3.
